Body: I was working with Unity and Hololens and tried to establish connection to Azure Iot Hub via MQTT protocol. Microsoft provides a tutorial for getting started with Azure IoT Hub in C#
column10:
I encountered a problem with the tutorial:

In the picture above
column11: I have selected Microsoft.Azure.Device NuGet package for installation. I have tried version 1.0.0 and also the latest one available
column12: 1.2.4. The projects were automatically generated by Unity and that is probably the reason
column13: why I do encounter this problem. Which problem? After I try to install the selected NuGet
column14:
I encounter the following error:

Could not install package 'Microsoft.Azure.Devices 1.2.4'. You are trying to install this package into a project that targets '.NETFramework
column17: but the package	  does not contain any assembly references or content files that are	  compatible with that framework. For more information
column18:
contact the package author.

I was like
column20:
I must have wrong .NET framework version. I wonder if I can change that..." I tried to go to project properties like this

Microsoft advises changing .NET framework from Properties context menu item: https://technet.microsoft.com/fi-fi/library/bb772098(v=vs.90).aspx (4.24.2017) https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb398202(v=vs.100).aspx (4.24.2017)

However
column21: this feature must be blocked by something
column22: because the view that is supposed to open flashes white and disappears immediately. I suppose Unity doesn't like people tinkering with project properties
column23: but what else can I do? Incompatible .NET framework issue needs to be resolved
column24: so that the NuGet package can be installed
column25:
but how do I do that?

In short
column26:
how to install Microsoft.Azure.Devices NuGet package for Unity?

"

Body:
Sorry, this isn't possible due Unity's restriction to .net 3.5.

To be exactly, they use a custom version of mono-2.

You could try the new (experimental) .net 4.6 settings in Unity 5.6.

https://forum.unity3d.com/threads/upgraded-mono-net-in-editor-on-5-5-0b4.433541/

"

Didn't mention Hololens, because I thought it really wouldn't matter that much, especially when it's quite a new product. I mean, obviously it's gonna work out... Right? XD But anyway, I'll add this detail to the question.

Oh. Well, tried out to change Api Compatibility Level, only to find out I cannot change it. I'm deploying for Hololens and I think Hololens is not very happy to support this experimental setting... Drat!
@HenriKorpela Add this information to your Q. I haven't any clue how HoloLens works with Unity3D.  I thought always it's just a WinRT" build."
What's your C# application type? UWP?
